_comment: SNES Hardware Register Documentation for ROM Hacking
_source: SNES Development Manual, anomie docs, fullsnes

INIDISP.description: Screen display register. Bit 7: Force blank (1=display off for VRAM access). Bits 3-0: Master brightness (0=black, 15=full). Set to $8F during init, $0F for normal display.

OBSEL.description: Object (sprite) size and base address. Bits 7-5: Sprite size (000=8x8/16x16 to 111=16x32/32x64). Bits 4-3: Name select (gap between sprite tables). Bits 2-0: Base address in VRAM (x8KB).

OAMADDR.description: OAM address register (low byte). Combined with OAMADDH to set write address in OAM (Object Attribute Memory). 512 bytes for 128 sprites + 32 bytes high table.

OAMADDL.description: OAM address low byte. Same as OAMADDR. Sets which sprite entry to write (0-127 x 4 bytes each).

OAMADDH.description: OAM address high byte and priority. Bit 7: OAM priority rotation (1=enable). Bit 0: High bit of OAM address (for high table access).

OAMDATA.description: OAM data write register. Write sprite data here after setting OAMADDR. Auto-increments. Format: X-pos, Y-pos, Tile#, Attributes (VHOOPPPC).

BGMODE.description: BG mode and tile size. Bits 7-4: BG tile size per layer (1=16x16, 0=8x8). Bit 3: BG3 priority in Mode 1. Bits 2-0: BG mode (0-7). ALTTP uses Mode 1.

MOSAIC.description: Mosaic effect. Bits 7-4: Mosaic size (0=1x1 to 15=16x16). Bits 3-0: Enable mosaic per BG layer. Used for screen transitions.

BG1SC.description: BG1 tilemap address and size. Bits 7-2: Tilemap VRAM address (x$400). Bits 1-0: Tilemap size (00=32x32, 01=64x32, 10=32x64, 11=64x64 tiles).

BG2SC.description: BG2 tilemap address and size. Same format as BG1SC. ALTTP uses BG2 for transparency overlays.

BG3SC.description: BG3 tilemap address and size. Same format as BG1SC. ALTTP uses BG3 for text and HUD elements.

BG4SC.description: BG4 tilemap address and size. Same format as BG1SC. Not commonly used in ALTTP.

BG12NBA.description: BG1/BG2 character (tile) data address. Bits 7-4: BG2 base (x$2000). Bits 3-0: BG1 base (x$2000). Points to tile graphics in VRAM.

BG34NBA.description: BG3/BG4 character data address. Bits 7-4: BG4 base. Bits 3-0: BG3 base. Same format as BG12NBA.

BG1HOFS.description: BG1 horizontal scroll. Write twice (low then high). 10-bit value. ALTTP camera X position. Write also affects Mode 7 scroll.

BG1VOFS.description: BG1 vertical scroll. Write twice. 10-bit value. ALTTP camera Y position.

BG2HOFS.description: BG2 horizontal scroll. Used for parallax effects and transparency layer positioning.

BG3HOFS.description: BG3 horizontal scroll. HUD/text layer usually fixed at 0.

VMAIN.description: VRAM address increment mode. Bit 7: Increment after high/low write (0=low $2118, 1=high $2119). Bits 3-2: Address translation. Bits 1-0: Increment amount (00=1, 01=32, 10=128, 11=128).

VMADDL.description: VRAM address low byte. Combined with VMADDH for 16-bit VRAM word address (64KB VRAM = 32K words).

VMADDH.description: VRAM address high byte. Set full VRAM address before writing tile/map data.

VMDATAL.description: VRAM data write low byte. Write graphics and tilemap data here. Auto-increments based on VMAIN setting.

VMDATAH.description: VRAM data write high byte. For 16-bit writes or when VMAIN bit 7 = 1.

M7SEL.description: Mode 7 settings. Bit 7-6: Screen over (00=wrap, 10=transparent, 11=tile 0). Bit 1: Vertical flip. Bit 0: Horizontal flip.

M7A.description: Mode 7 matrix A (cosine). Write twice for 16-bit signed. Used for rotation/scaling. Also used for signed multiplication.

M7B.description: Mode 7 matrix B (sine). Write twice. Rotation angle sine component. Also multiplicand for M7A*M7B multiplication.

M7C.description: Mode 7 matrix C (-sine). Write twice. Rotation matrix element.

M7D.description: Mode 7 matrix D (cosine). Write twice. Scaling/rotation matrix element.

M7X.description: Mode 7 center X. Write twice for 13-bit signed. Rotation/scaling center point.

M7Y.description: Mode 7 center Y. Write twice for 13-bit signed.

CGADD.description: CGRAM (palette) address. 0-255 for 256 colors. Write before CGDATA to set palette entry.

CGDATA.description: CGRAM data write. Write twice per color (low then high). Format: xBBBBBGG GGGRRRRR (15-bit RGB555).

W12SEL.description: Window 1/2 mask settings for BG1/BG2. Each 2 bits: enable and invert per window per layer.

WOBJSEL.description: Window mask for sprites (OBJ) and color math.

WH0.description: Window 1 left position (0-255). Pixels left of this are outside window 1.

WH1.description: Window 1 right position. Pixels right of this are outside window 1.

WBGLOG.description: Window mask logic for BG layers. 2 bits per layer: 00=OR, 01=AND, 10=XOR, 11=XNOR.

WOBJLOG.description: Window mask logic for OBJ and color math.

TM.description: Main screen designation. Bits 4-0 enable OBJ,BG4,BG3,BG2,BG1 on main screen. Essential for layer visibility.

TS.description: Sub screen designation. Same format as TM. Sub screen used for color math blending.

TMW.description: Window mask for main screen. Disable layers inside/outside windows.

CGWSEL.description: Color math control. Bits 7-6: Force main black. Bits 5-4: Color math enable. Bit 1: Sub screen/fixed color. Bit 0: Direct color mode.

CGADSUB.description: Color math add/subtract select. Bit 7: 0=add, 1=subtract. Bit 6: Half result. Bits 5-0: Enable per layer and backdrop.

COLDATA.description: Fixed color for color math. Bits 7-5: Select R/G/B channel (can set multiple). Bits 4-0: Color intensity (0-31).

SETINI.description: Screen mode/video select. Bit 7: External sync. Bit 6: Mode 7 EXTBG. Bit 3: Pseudo-hires. Bit 2: Overscan. Bit 0: Interlace.

MPYL.description: Multiplication result low byte. Read M7A*M7B signed multiplication result (24-bit). PPU math.

SLHV.description: Software latch H/V counter. Read to latch current scanline position into OPHCT/OPVCT.

RDOAM.description: OAM data read. Read sprite data after setting OAMADDR.

RDVRAML.description: VRAM data read low byte. Must read once to prime, then data is available.

RDCGRAM.description: CGRAM (palette) data read. Read palette colors after setting CGADD.

OPHCT.description: Horizontal scanline counter. Read twice for 9-bit value. Latched by SLHV read.

OPVCT.description: Vertical scanline counter. Read twice for 9-bit value. Current rendering line.

STAT77.description: PPU status 1. Bit 7: Time over (>34 sprites/line). Bit 6: Range over (>8 tiles/sprite/line). Bits 3-0: PPU1 version.

STAT78.description: PPU status 2. Bit 7: Interlace field. Bit 6: External latch. Bit 4: PAL/NTSC. Bits 3-0: PPU2 version.

APUIO0.description: APU I/O port 0. Communication with SPC700 audio processor. Write commands, read status. Used for music/SFX control.

APUIO1.description: APU I/O port 1. Additional command/data port for audio communication.

APUIO2.description: APU I/O port 2. Audio data transfer port.

APUIO3.description: APU I/O port 3. Audio data transfer port.

WMDATA.description: WRAM data read/write. Access work RAM through this port after setting WMADD.

WMADDL.description: WRAM address low byte. Part of 17-bit WRAM address (128KB).

WMADDH.description: WRAM address high bit. Bit 0 only (for 128KB addressing).

JOYWR.description: Joypad write/strobe. Write 1 then 0 to latch controller state for manual reading.

JOYA.description: Joypad 1 data. Bit 0: Serial controller data. Read 16 times for full button state.

JOYB.description: Joypad 2 data. Same as JOYA for player 2.

NMITIMEN.description: Interrupt enable. Bit 7: NMI enable (ESSENTIAL). Bit 5: V-IRQ. Bit 4: H-IRQ. Bit 0: Auto-joypad read.

WRIO.description: Programmable I/O port. Controller port pin 6 output.

WRMPYA.description: Multiplication operand A. 8-bit unsigned. Result in RDMPYL/H after 8 cycles.

WRMPYB.description: Multiplication operand B. Writing starts A*B calculation.

WRDIVL.description: Dividend low byte. 16-bit unsigned dividend for division.

WRDIVB.description: Divisor. 8-bit. Writing starts division. Result in RDDIVL/H, remainder in RDMPYL/H.

HTIMEL.description: H-IRQ timer low byte. 9-bit H-counter compare value.

VTIMEL.description: V-IRQ timer low byte. 9-bit V-counter compare value for scanline IRQ.

MDMAEN.description: DMA enable. Bits 7-0 enable DMA channels 7-0. Write to start immediate DMA transfer.

HDMAEN.description: HDMA enable. Bits 7-0 enable HDMA channels. HDMA runs automatically each scanline.

MEMSEL.description: ROM access speed. Bit 0: 0=2.68MHz (slow), 1=3.58MHz (fast). Set to 1 for FastROM.

RDNMI.description: NMI flag and version. Bit 7: NMI occurred (cleared on read). Bits 3-0: CPU version. Read in NMI handler.

TIMEUP.description: IRQ flag. Bit 7: IRQ occurred (cleared on read). Read in IRQ handler to acknowledge.

HVBJOY.description: PPU status. Bit 7: V-blank. Bit 6: H-blank. Bit 0: Auto-joypad in progress. Wait for bit 0 clear before reading JOYXL/H.

RDDIVL.description: Division quotient low byte. Result of WRDIVL:H / WRDIVB.

RDMPYL.description: Multiplication result low / Division remainder low. Dual purpose register.

RDMPYH.description: Multiplication result high / Division remainder high.

JOY1L.description: Joypad 1 low byte (auto-read). Bits: AXLR0000. Wait for HVBJOY bit 0 clear first.

JOY1H.description: Joypad 1 high byte. Bits: BYsSudlr (Select, Start, Up, Down, Left, Right).

DMAP0.description: DMA channel 0 parameters. Bits 7-6: Direction/mode. Bit 6: HDMA indirect. Bit 5: Address decrement. Bit 4: Fixed address. Bit 3: A→B or B→A. Bits 2-0: Transfer mode.

BBAD0.description: DMA channel 0 B-bus address. PPU register offset ($2100 + this value).

A1T0L.description: DMA channel 0 A-bus address low. Source/dest in CPU address space.

DAS0L.description: DMA channel 0 byte count low. Number of bytes to transfer.

A2A0L.description: DMA channel 0 HDMA table current address low.

A2A0H.description: DMA channel 0 HDMA table current address high.

DMAP1.description: DMA channel 1 parameters. Same format as DMAP0.

bank_map.$00-$3F: LoROM: First 32KB of each bank mirrors to $8000-$FFFF

Palette_Load.purpose: Color palette loading - hook for time system

common_patterns.state_machine: %SpriteJumpTable(State0, State1, State2) with RTS per state
common_patterns.table_expansion: Extend pointer tables by redirecting to expanded bank
